text.p: KEY INDICATORS - LATEST FIGURES
(Yr/Yr pct change unless otherwise stated)
INDICATOR PERIOD PREVIOUS YEAR AGO
GDP (at constant prices) Q1 96 1.0 Q4 95 1.8 Q1 95 1.7
Inflation (CPI) Sep 96 1.97 Aug 1.92 Sep 95 1.19
Unemployment* Sep 96 14.2 Aug 14.5 Sep 95 14.8
Total registered jobless 607,699 620,081 628,632
Sources: GDP (seasonally adjusted) Q1 1996 data provisional -
National Bank of Belgium; inflation - Economics Ministry;
unemployment - National Employment Office.
Note: * Total registered jobless (whether or not they receive
unemployment benefits) as a percentage of the workforce.
EUROPEAN UNION FORECASTS FOR BELGIAN ECONOMY
(Yr/Yr pct change unless otherwise stated)
INDICATOR 1997e 1996e 1995e 1994
GDP (at constant prices) 2.3 1.1 1.9 2.2
Inflation* 1.8 2.0 1.5 3.0
Unemployment** 9.8 10.1 9.9 10.0
Govt net borrowing requirement*** 3.7 3.2 4.5 5.3
Source: European Union Spring 1996 forecasts.
Note: * inflation based on deflator of private consumption,
which differs slightly from Economics Ministry's CPI.
** unemployment as a percentage of the civilian labour force.
*** general government net borrowing as a percentage of GDP:
1994 figure includes 12.7 bln bfr proceeds from the sale of
participations indirectly owned by the public sector; N.B. govt
intentions to make substantial additional budget adjustments for
1997 to be included in Autumn 1996 forecasts.
KEY CENTRAL BANK INTEREST RATES
central rate 3.00 pct, cut from 3.20 pct on 23-08-96
end-of-day rate 4.25 pct, cut from 4.45 pct on 23-08-96
Note: the central rate applies to overnight lending for primary
dealers of government debt, the end-of-day rate to overnight
lending for all others. Financial institutions can only draw
funds at these rates up to fixed amounts.
The central rate is the equivalent of the German repo rate.
STATE FINANCES
(as a percentage of GDP unless otherwise stated)
Public debt (EMU definition)* 133.5 135.1 137.0
Public deficit (EMU definition)* 4.1 5.1 7.5
Treasury net financing requirement** 3.7 4.1 5.2
latest cumulative: first 8 months 1996 first 8 months 1995
(in blns of bfr) 343.2 317.1
Sources: * National Bank of Belgium (1995 figures are National
Bank estimates)
** Finance Ministry/National Bank of Belgium, based on Finance
Ministry definition - figures represent central government cash
deficit with expenditure booked on the actual day it is made
rather than the day it falls due.
Note: EMU public deficit criterion: below or approaching three
percent of GDP; EMU public debt criterion: below or approaching
60 percent of GDP.
